description: A tiger face, which is displayed on major platforms with a cute cartoon appearance.

title: 🍶 Sake
description: Japanese sake, an alcoholic beverage made from rice. Shown as a sake set with a carafe (tokkuri) and drinking cup (choko). Color varies widely by platform, with Apple, WhatsApp, and Twitter featuring blue, a traditional ceramic color. Samsung displays the Japanese script for “sake” in red.

title: 🇲🇬 Flag: Madagascar
description: The flag for Madagascar, which may show as the letters MG on some platforms

title: 🥬 Leafy Green
description: A head of a rich green leaf vegetable, usually shown with white stalks. May be used to represent a variety of greens, including romaine lettuce, chard, and Chinese cabbage like bok choy, as commonly cooked in Asian cuisines.

title: 🤷‍♂️ Man Shrugging
description: The Man Shrugging emoji is a sequence of the 🤷 Shrug and ♂ Male Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🀄 Mahjong Red Dragon
description: The red dragon tile in the game of Japanese Mahjong. White, with red 中 character printed on it.

title: 🦐 Shrimp
description: Shrimp was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

title: 😊 Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes
description: A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, closed smile turning up to rosy cheeks. Often expresses genuine happiness and warm, positive feelings.

title: 🍮 Custard
description: A golden-yellow custard dessert, as a crème caramel or flan, topped with a layer of caramel. Shown on a plate, molded in a ramekin-shape and often in a pool of caramel sauce.

title: ❣️ Heavy Heart Exclamation
description: A decorative exclamation mark, where a heart forms the top part of the symbol, and a circle the lower part. Similar to the way to the man in business suit levitating also creates a similar shape.

title: 🚅 Bullet Train
description: A high speed train, designed to cover long distances at high speed. Also features a streamlined bullet nose, often used in reference to the Shinkansen in Japan.

title: 👏 Clapping Hands
description: Two hands clapping emoji, which when used multiple times can be used as a round of applause.

title: ☘️ Shamrock
description: A three-leaf clover, otherwise known as a shamrock. Commonly used on St Patrick's Day in Ireland and around the world, as it is said that he used the shamrock as a symbol to explain the Christian Holy Trinity.

title: ✅ White Heavy Check Mark
description: A check mark that displays with a white outlined appearance. Shows on most platforms with a bright green rounded rectangle or circle surrounding it.

title: 🇱🇧 Flag: Lebanon
description: The flag for Lebanon, which may show as the letters LB on some platforms.

title: 🇦🇪 Flag: United Arab Emirates
description: The flag for United Arab Emirates, which may show as the letters AE on some platforms.

title: ◾ Black Medium-Small Square
description: Black Medium-Small Square was approved as part of Unicode 3.2 in 2002  under the name “Black Medium Small Square” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🇨🇩 Flag: Congo - Kinshasa
description: The Flag: Congo - Kinshasa emoji is a sequence of the 🇨 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter C and 🇩 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter D emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🛴 Kick Scooter
description: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles.

title: 🕜 One-Thirty
description: One-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face One-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 😔 Pensive Face
description: A pensive, remorseful face. Saddened by life. Quietly considering where things all went wrong. Depicted as a yellow face with sad, closed eyes, furrowed eyebrows, and a slight, flat mouth.

title: 🥥 Coconut
description: The hairy shell of a tropical coconut, cracked in a half to show its milky-white meat. Google displays a whole coconut alongside a half-shell.

title: 🐦 Bird
description: A bird, with no species specified. Appears like a sparrow on Android (blue, previously yellow), Windows (blue) and Twitter (red). Only shows the head of the (gray) bird in Apple’s artwork.

title: 😸 Grinning Cat Face With Smiling Eyes
description: A cartoon cat variant of 😄 Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes. Depicted as yellow on major platforms.

title: 🤐 Zipper-Mouth Face
description: A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a closed zipper for a mouth. Meaning widely varies, but commonly conveys a secret or that someone will keep one (e.g., My lips are sealed). May also be used to tell someone to stop talking (e.g., Zip it! or I’ll shut up now).

title: 🚡 Aerial Tramway
description: An Aerial Tramway, most commonly seen at ski resorts, for transport between locations on a mountain. Can also be used as a tourist attraction, or as a form of public transport.

title: 🇷🇸 Flag: Serbia
description: The flag for Serbia, which may show as the letters RS on some platforms.

title: 4️⃣ Keycap Digit Four
description: The Keycap Digit Four emoji is a sequence of the 4 Digit Four and ⃣ Combining Enclosing Keycap emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🌾 Sheaf of Rice
description: A rice crop, growing in the ground before harvesting.

title: 🇮🇸 Flag: Iceland
description: The flag for Iceland, which may show as the letters IS on some platforms.

title: ♋ Cancer
description: The Cancer astrological sign in the Zodiac. This Zodiac Symbol represents a Crab.

title: 🍹 Tropical Drink
description: A sunset-orange-colored tropical beverage in a stemmed glass, as a rum punch or mai tai. Served with a straw and fruit garnish. Many platforms include a cocktail umbrella, hence umbrella drink. Samsung previously featured an electric-blue concoction. See also Cocktail Glass.

title: 🏯 Japanese Castle
description: A traditional Japanese Castle, usually made from stone and wood.

title: ☣️ Biohazard
description: Biohazard was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the name “Biohazard Sign” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 👨‍🦰 Man: Red Hair
description: A man with red hair. Sometimes described as ginger, orange, copper, or auburn.

title: 👨‍🚒 Man Firefighter
description: The Man Firefighter emoji is a sequence of the 👨 Man and 🚒 Fire Engine emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🤷‍♀️ Woman Shrugging
description: The Woman Shrugging emoji is a sequence of the 🤷 Shrug and ♀ Female Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🌌 Milky Way
description: The Milky Way – a galaxy of billions of stars that includes our own solar system and planet earth.

title: 🏳️‍⚧️ Transgender Flag
description: The Transgender Flag is a draft candidate for Emoji 13.0 under the name Blue, Pink, and White Flag.

title: 🕘 Nine O’Clock
description: Nine O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Nine O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 👤 Bust in Silhouette
description: Generic profile of one person. Often used in interface design to represent a user.

title: 🈯 Japanese “Reserved” Button
description: This character translates as meaning a finger or toe pointing to indicate a certain direction.

title: 🏴‍☠️ Pirate Flag
description: A skull and crossbones displayed on a black flag, used on pirate ships, also known as a Jolly Roger.

title: 🇸🇸 Flag: South Sudan
description: The flag for South Sudan, which may show as the letters SS on some platforms.

title: ♈ Aries
description: The Aries astrological sign in the Zodiac. This Zodiac Symbol represents a Ram.

title: 👩‍🏫 Woman Teacher
description: A woman standing in front of a chalkboard (aka blackboard) with the intention of teaching a class.

title: 🧲 Magnet
description: A horseshoe magnet, as used to pick up iron. Depicted at various angles in red with silver-tipped poles.

title: 🕵️ Detective
description: An undercover investigator, wearing a hat, and sometimes using a magnifying glass to closely inspect evidence. This emoji did not originally recommend emoji modifiers, but a proposal was created to address this.

title: 🍫 Chocolate Bar
description: A block of dark chocolate, usually shown in a red foil wrapper peeled back to show squares of the candy. WhatsApp displays the wrapper in purple, a color commonly associated with Cadbury chocolate.

title: 🍃 Leaf Fluttering in Wind
description: A leaf (or leaves in the Apple artwork) fluttering in a gentle breeze, falling to the ground.

title: 🧕 Woman With Headscarf
description: A person (generally depicted as a woman) wearing a headscarf. While the type of  headscarf is not specified, this is most commonly displayed as a woman wearing a hijab.

title: 📏 Straight Ruler
description: A ruler, as used to draw straight lines and measure distances. Variously depicted as a metal, wood, or plastic straightedge with length markings at a 45° angle.

title: 🍇 Grapes
description: A grape bunch, as cut from the vine and used to make wine. Depicted as red (purple-colored) grapes.

title: 👳 Person Wearing Turban
description: A man wearing a turban; a form of customary headwear worn by Sikhs or Muslims.

title: 👮 Police Officer
description: This police officer wears a blue hat, which features a gold badge or shield in the middle.

title: 💓 Beating Heart
description: A heart with vibration / movement lines above it, indicating it is a beating heart. Displayed in pink or red on most platforms, this emoji is intended to be used as a beating heart representing either life, or love.

title: 🇺🇲 Flag: U.S. Outlying Islands
description: The flag for U.S. Outlying Islands, which may show as the letters UM on some platforms. This is the same flag as the United States.

title: 🇬🇭 Flag: Ghana
description: The flag for Ghana, which may show as the letters GH on some platforms.

title: 🇹🇼 Flag: Taiwan
description: The flag for Taiwan (officially Republic of China), which may show as the letters TW on some platforms.

title: ♌ Leo
description: The Leo astrological sign in the Zodiac. This Zodiac Symbol represents a Lion.

title: ➰ Curly Loop
description: A curled loop, which is shown in black on most platforms. Displayed as a blue ribbon on Samsung devices.

title: 🧞 Genie
description: A supernatural being, which is generally shown to be imprisoned within a bottle or lamp. May be capable of granting wishes when summoned. Variations exist for a female genie or male genie.

title: 🏳️‍🌈 Rainbow Flag
description: A flag with six colors of the rainbow, generally including red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple. Commonly used by the LGBT movement as a gay pride flag, or simply pride flag.

title: 🦜 Parrot
description: Parrot was approved as part of Unicode 11.0 in 2018 and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

title: 🎅 Santa Claus
description: Santa Claus, sometimes referred to as Father Christmas, brings joy to children at Christmas time. Displayed with a beard and red festive hat.

title: 🇻🇬 Flag: British Virgin Islands
description: The flag for British Virgin Islands, which may show as the letters VG on some platforms.

title: 🛅 Left Luggage
description: An icon representing a place to leave luggage. Most commonly found at Japanese train stations to signify coin lockers where bags can be stored for a daily fee.

title: 🌪️ Tornado
description: A tornado appearing to come from within a cloud in the sky.

title: 🔂 Repeat Single Button
description: Arrows pointing in a clockwise direction, with a number 1 badge in the lower corner.  Used in music player applications to loop a track or album once.

title: 🧘 Person in Lotus Position
description: Person in Lotus Position was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

title: 📝 Memo
description: A white piece of paper with text written on it by a yellow pencil, positioned over the sheet, tip down, at a 45° angle. Commonly used for content concerning various types of documents and writing, including signing (in sports).

title: 🧱 Brick
description: A red brick or bricks. Depicted in a loose stack, a single object with holes, or as built into wall, as of a house, school, or other structure.

title: 🇨🇫 Flag: Central African Republic
description: The flag for Central African Republic, which may show as the letters CF on some platforms.

title: 🧤 Gloves
description: Gloves was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

title: 💋 Kiss Mark
description: The mark left after a firm kiss is placed with bright lipstick. Used in place of ‘xxx’ (kisses), or to send a kiss to someone. More seductive than the kiss emoji.

title: 🈸 Japanese “Application” Button
description: This Emoji has two meanings.

title: 🐹 Hamster Face
description: A cute hamster, with pink ears, orange over half its face, and white/gray for the other part of the face. Has three whiskers on each side.

title: 🇸🇹 Flag: São Tomé & Príncipe
description: The Flag: São Tomé & Príncipe emoji is a sequence of the 🇸 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter S and 🇹 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter T emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🚟 Suspension Railway
description: Similar to a monorail, a suspension railway is elevated, but the vehicle is suspended under the track.

title: 🆖 NG Button
description: The letters NG, shown enclosed in a square, which are an acronym for the words No Good.

title: 🐲 Dragon Face
description: The face of a dragon, showing only the head. Shown primarily in green on most platforms. Also available as an Animoji on iOS.

title: 🕢 Seven-Thirty
description: Seven-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Seven-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🏳️ White Flag
description: A white flag, shown waving on a post. Traditionally used as a sign of surrender, the meaning of this flag as an emoji is less defined.

title: 🍟 French Fries
description: Thin-cut, golden-brown French fries, served in a red carton, as at McDonald’s. Apple features Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes on its carton.

title: 🇦🇩 Flag: Andorra
description: The flag for Andorra, which may show as the letters AD on some platforms.

title: 👨‍🦲 Man: Bald
description: The Man: Bald emoji is a sequence of the 👨 Man and 🦲 Emoji Component Bald emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: ⏏️ Eject Button
description: An eject symbol, displayed as an upward-pointing triangle above a horiztonal bar. May be used as a physical button or an icon in a user interface. Represents the action of ejecting physical media such as a floppy disk, videocasette or DVD on a computer or media player.

title: 🇰🇳 Flag: St. Kitts & Nevis
description: The Flag: St. Kitts & Nevis emoji is a sequence of the 🇰 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter K and 🇳 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter N emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: ✈️ Airplane
description: Used either as a literal airplane, or sometimes to represent an overseas vacation, or airplane mode on a phone or tablet.

title: 🚻 Restroom
description: A restroom symbol, depicting a iconography of a man and woman. Used to indicate the location of public bathrooms / toilets / restrooms.

title: 3️⃣ Keycap Digit Three
description: The Keycap Digit Three emoji is a sequence of the 3 Digit Three and ⃣ Combining Enclosing Keycap emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🐷 Pig Face
description: A pig’s head, distinct from the pig emoji, which shows the full pig body. Displayed forward-facing, with a distinctive snout. Also available as an Animoji on iOS.

title: 🧰 Toolbox
description: A red box for holding and transporting tools, such as a hammer and wrench. Generally depicted as latched shut with silver hardware and a black handle.

title: 🤸‍♀️ Woman Cartwheeling
description: The Woman Cartwheeling emoji is a sequence of the 🤸 Person Doing Cartwheel and ♀ Female Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🦘 Kangaroo
description: Kangaroo was approved as part of Unicode 11.0 in 2018 and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

title: 😠 Angry Face
description: A yellow face with a frowning mouth and eyes and eyebrows scrunched downward in anger. Google’s design features a reddish face and Facebook’s, clenched teeth.

title: 🇭🇹 Flag: Haiti
description: The flag for Haiti, which may show as the letters HT on some platforms.

title: 🇧🇬 Flag: Bulgaria
description: The flag for Bulgaria, which may show as the letters BG on some platforms.

title: 🌓 First Quarter Moon
description: The moon shown with the right side lit, and the rest in shadow.

title: 🛹 Skateboard
description: A skateboard emoji, shown on some platforms from the top and others showing the under-side of the board.

title: 🇧🇱 Flag: St. Barthélemy
description: The Flag: St. Barthélemy emoji is a sequence of the 🇧 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter B and 🇱 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter L emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🚾 Water Closet
description: A water closet is a name used for public toilet, bathroom or restroom used in some countries. Typically abbreviated to the letters WC, this may be found on signage in public buildings, as an alternative to the restroom symbol.

title: ☁️ Cloud
description: A cumulus cloud, which shows on some systems as a silhouette in black, and on other systems as a shaded white cloud.

title: 🙇‍♂️ Man Bowing
description: The male version of the 🙇 Person Bowing Deeply emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: 🎓 Graduation Cap
description: A graduation cap, worn on the head of students graduating from college or university. Known in some locations as a mortar board with tassel.

title: 🚶 Person Walking
description: A person going for a walk. Taking a slow-medium pace, this person would be a runner if they picked up their speed.

title: ⏱️ Stopwatch
description: An analog, handheld timepiece used to measure elapsed time, as for athletic sprints. Appearance varies across platforms, but depicted with two or more control buttons on its top.

title: 🇰🇵 Flag: North Korea
description: The flag for North Korea, which may show as the letters KP on some platforms.

title: 💅 Nail Polish
description: Colored nail polish being applied to finger nails, often used to display an air of nonchalance or indifference.

title: 🎒 Backpack
description: A school bag Emoji (also called a satchel) used by children attending school to carry books, lunch, and other personal belongings.

title: 🇨🇲 Flag: Cameroon
description: The flag for Cameroon, which may show as the letters CM on some platforms.

title: 🚘 Oncoming Automobile
description: A car being shown from the front. The windscreen and hood (bonnet in British English) of the car can be seen facing forward.

title: ⬅️ Left Arrow
description: An arrow, pointing left.

title: 🕙 Ten O’Clock
description: Ten O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Ten O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: ⚰️ Coffin
description: A traditional coffin, as used to bury the dead. Depicted at various angles as a closed, six-sided, wooden coffin, tapered at the head and foot with golden handles.

title: 🇹🇴 Flag: Tonga
description: The flag for Tonga, which may show as the letters TO on some platforms.

title: 🏸 Badminton
description: Badminton was approved as part of Unicode 8.0 in 2015 under the name “Badminton Racquet and Shuttlecock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🚧 Construction
description: A sign used to indicate roadwork or construction. Generally shown as yellow and black diagonal stripes, and often used to physically block access to a road or area. May be used to imply a website or project in progress or under construction.

title: 👽 Alien
description: A classic alien face. The oval, bare head of a gray or green alien with large black eyes and a slight, friendly smile. Samsung depicts nostrils, Facebook a nose.

title: 🗜️ Clamp
description: A metal clamp or vice, as screwed to hold or compress materials like wood or metal. Depicted as a C-clamp or F-clamp, its screw in various positions.

title: 🍠 Roasted Sweet Potato
description: A sweet potato depicted with textured purple, orange, or brown skin and sliced in half to show its golden-brown flesh. Sometimes called a yam, though they are unrelated. Not to be confused with the Potato.

title: 🍏 Green Apple
description: A common green apple, tarter counterpart to the Red Apple. Displayed with a stem and single, green leaf on major platforms.

title: 🇾🇪 Flag: Yemen
description: The flag for Yemen, which may show as the letters YE on some platforms.

title: 👒 Woman’s Hat
description: A hat worn by women for sun protection, or for fashion.

title: 🇬🇸 Flag: South Georgia & South Sandwich Islands
description: The Flag: South Georgia & South Sandwich Islands emoji is a sequence of the 🇬 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter G and 🇸 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter S emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 👧 Girl
description: The face of a girl, smiling. Differentiated from the woman emoji by the hairstyle which features pigtails which are not present on the woman.

title: 🕗 Eight O’Clock
description: Eight O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eight O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 📥 Inbox Tray
description: A paper tray with a down arrow on top, as a symbol for an email inbox. Generally depicted as a white or wooden try with a red or green arrow.

title: 🚉 Station
description: A station, presumed to be a train station. Displays a train alongside a platform, where passengers can board.

title: 🕑 Two O’Clock
description: Two O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Two O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🙄 Face With Rolling Eyes
description: A yellow face with a small, closed mouth, flat or frowning, rolling its large, white eyes upwards. As with the gesture of an eye-roll, commonly conveys moderate disdain, disapproval, frustration, or boredom. Tone varies, including playful, sassy, resentful, and sarcastic, as if saying Yeah, whatever.

title: ❔ White Question Mark
description: White Question Mark was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “White Question Mark Ornament” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🧝‍♀️ Woman Elf
description: The Woman Elf emoji is a sequence of the 🧝 Elf and ♀ Female Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🇬🇩 Flag: Grenada
description: The flag for Grenada, which may show as the letters GD on some platforms.

title: 🌈 Rainbow
description: A pretty rainbow emoji in a clear sky, which tends to appear when there is a light rain or mist in the air, at the same time as sunshine.

title: ❤️ Red Heart
description: A classic love heart emoji, used for expressions of love. Displayed in various shades of red on most platforms. A similar emoji exists for the heart suit in a deck of playing cards.

title: 🧿 Nazar Amulet
description: A nazar, an eye-shaped amulet believed to protect against the evil eye, especially in Turkish culture. Depicted as a rich blue, circular bead with a black dot in the center ringed with white and light blue, resembling an eye.

title: ✋ Raised Hand
description: A hand held up showing its palm. May be used to mean stop, or as a high-five.

title: 🛰️ Satellite
description: A satellite which orbits the earth, and is generally used for communications, weather, and GPS.

title: ⛴️ Ferry
description: Ferry was approved as part of Unicode 5.2 in 2009 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🕦 Eleven-Thirty
description: Eleven-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eleven-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🇦🇹 Flag: Austria
description: The flag for Austria, which may show as the letters AT on some platforms.

title: 🗿 Moai
description: A moai, one of the famed, giant stone statues of human figures on Easter Island. Depicted as a gray stone carving of a stylized human head with a prominent brow and nose, most often facing left.

title: 🔲 Black Square Button
description: Black Square Button was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🤗 Hugging Face
description: A yellow face smiling with open hands, as if giving a hug. Many platforms feature the same expression as their 😊 Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes.

title: 🇦🇫 Flag: Afghanistan
description: The flag for Afghanistan, which may show as the letters AF on some platforms.

title: 🆒 Cool Button
description: The word cool, shown enclosed in a square. This generally displays in a shade of blue, or blue-gray on most platforms. Used as a text decoration.

title: 🔮 Crystal Ball
description: A crystal ball, as a fortune teller or clairvoyant gazes into to tell the future. Depicted as a sparkling, purple or blue crystal orb resting on a stand.

title: 👯 People With Bunny Ears
description: An iteration of the Playboy Bunny known in Japan as a Bunny Girl. Usually depicted as an attractive woman  wearing bunny ears; a bunny girl can also be seen in anime as a hybrid human/animal known as Kemonomimi.

title: 🇲🇶 Flag: Martinique
description: The flag for Martinique, which may show as the letters MQ on some platforms.

title: 🏮 Red Paper Lantern
description: A red paper lantern, as hangs outside an izakaya, a Japanese bar that serves drinks and casual food. Generally depicted as cylindrical with a black top and base and soft, orange glow.

title: 🖤 Black Heart
description: A heart shaded completely black. May be used to express morbidity, sorrow, or a form of dark humor.

title: 🔸 Small Orange Diamond
description: A small version of the large orange diamond emoji.

title: 🇳🇵 Flag: Nepal
description: The flag for Nepal, which may show as the letters NP on some platforms.

title: 🇱🇹 Flag: Lithuania
description: The flag for Lithuania, which may show as the letters LT on some platforms.

title: 💜 Purple Heart
description: A purple heart emoji. Shown as pink in Android 4.4.

title: 🦵 Leg
description: A human leg, shown detached from a human body. Displayed from the thigh and may include the foot.

title: 🎰 Slot Machine
description: A gambling machine generally found in casinos. Shows three wheels with a lever to the side. Most platforms display three 7 digits on this emoji.

title: ⚠️ Warning
description: A triangle with an exclamation mark inside, used as a warning or alert.

title: 🇬🇦 Flag: Gabon
description: The flag for Gabon, which may show as the letters GA on some platforms.

title: 🕔 Five O’Clock
description: Five O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Five O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 👥 Busts in Silhouette
description: Generic profile of two people. Often used in interface design to represent users.

title: 💉 Syringe
description: A medical syringe, as used to administer a shot or draw blood. Generally depicted at a 45° angle with a needle to the upper right, emitting two droplets of the red fluid in its barrel, as blood drawn for testing or donation at a hospital.

title: 🤣 Rolling on the Floor Laughing
description: A yellow face with a big grin and scrunched, X-shaped eyes, tilted on its side as if rolling on the floor laughing (the internet acronym ROFL). Sheds two tears and tilts right on most platforms. Often conveys hysterical laughter more intense than 😂 Face With Tears of Joy.

title: 🚆 Train
description: A train, of no specified type. Due to the presence of a steam train and fast train emoji, this is likely to be a regular electrified or diesel passenger train.

title: ☂️ Umbrella
description: An umbrella with a hooked handle, open and with no rain falling on it, unlike the umbrella with raindrops.

title: 🧧 Red Envelope
description: A red envelope, as gifted with money on Chinese New Year or on other joyous occasions, such as weddings, in Chinese and some other Asian cultures around the world.

title: 🇫🇮 Flag: Finland
description: The flag for Finland, which may show as the letters FI on some platforms.

title: 🍣 Sushi
description: Japanese sushi, generally depicted as two pieces of raw pinkish-orange fish, as tuna or salmon, on white rice (nigiri). Some platforms show the cylindrical maki, a piece of seafood, vegetables, and white rice wrapped in seaweed (nori).

title: 🛐 Place of Worship
description: A building used for worship by people of any faith or religion. Examples include a church, mosque, or synagogue. A person is shown on their knees praying, in this symbol.

title: 🏊 Person Swimming
description: A person swimming in a pool, the ocean, or another body of water. Lacked goggles on prior versions of iOS.

title: 🕒 Three O’Clock
description: Three O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Three O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 7️⃣ Keycap Digit Seven
description: The Keycap Digit Seven emoji is a sequence of the 7 Digit Seven and ⃣ Combining Enclosing Keycap emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 😄 Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes
description: A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general happiness and good-natured amusement.

title: 👩‍🌾 Woman Farmer
description: The Woman Farmer emoji is a sequence of the 👩 Woman and 🌾 Ear of Rice emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🕷️ Spider
description: A black spider with eight legs, with similar appearance to a funnel-web spider.

title: 🇵🇫 Flag: French Polynesia
description: The flag for French Polynesia, which may show as the letters PF on some platforms.

title: ↪️ Left Arrow Curving Right
description: An arrow pointing to the right, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a forward icon in an email application.

title: ☢️ Radioactive
description: A hazard symbol for radiation or radioactivity. May appear similar to a three-pronged fan at small sizes.

title: 🐉 Dragon
description: As a mythological creature, the dragon is generally displayed in many Chinese and Japanese traditions.

title: 🕉️ Om
description: A symbol often used in relation to the religions of Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism and Jainism.

title: 🤞 Crossed Fingers
description: A fingers crossed emoji which displays the index (first) finger crossed over the middle (second) finger. Commonly used as a gesture indicating luck, or to show desire of a favorable outcome.

title: 🌥️ Sun Behind Large Cloud
description: The sun shown behind a cloud, with about 20% of it visible. Very similar to the sun behind cloud emoji, but with less sun visible.

title: 💐 Bouquet
description: A collection of colorful flowers arranged in a bouquet and often given as a gift for a wedding, mother’s day, valentine’s day, or other occassion.

title: 🎫 Ticket
description: A paper ticket, which may be for a theatre show, sporting event, or other ticketed performance. Shown in blue, yellow or grey on most platforms.

title: 🎭 Performing Arts
description: Two masks often used on maps to indicate a theatre, these originate in Greek Theatre as masks of tragedy and comedy.

title: 🐔 Chicken
description: A chicken with a yellow beak, red comb on top of the head, and red wattle (under the chin). Not to be mistaken with the rooster emoji. Also available as an Animoji on iOS.

title: 🔤 Input Latin Letters
description: A symbol showing the lowercase letters a, b, c and d. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screen to enable alphabetical input, as opposed to numeric or symbol input.

title: 🇻🇳 Flag: Vietnam
description: The flag for Vietnam, which may show as the letters VN on some platforms.

title: 🌫️ Fog
description: Fog or haze lingering in the air. Similar to the foggy emoji, but generally shown without objects or views being obstructed by fog.

title: 🇱🇾 Flag: Libya
description: The flag for Libya, which may show as the letters LY on some platforms.

title: 😾 Pouting Cat Face
description: A cartoon cat variant of 😡 Pouting Face. Also resembles 😠 Angry Face. Depicted as yellow on major platforms. Sometimes used to represent the internet meme and celebrity Grumpy Cat.

title: 🇲🇻 Flag: Maldives
description: The flag for Maldives, which may show as the letters MV on some platforms.

title: ©️ Copyright
description: Copyright was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the name “Copyright Sign” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🚈 Light Rail
description: A form of public transport similar to a tram, but running on a track or network separated from cars and other types of traffic.

title: ⛷️ Skier
description: A person downhill-skiiing. Displayed with poles and skis, generally wearing a mask.

title: 🔔 Bell
description: A gold or yellow bell, which is commonly used on mobile phones as an icon for notifications or ringing sounds.

title: 👨‍👨‍👧‍👦 Family: Man, Man, Girl, Boy
description: A family with two fathers, one daughter, and one son.

title: 🕎 Menorah
description: A menorah showing nine lit candles, used on the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah.

title: 😅 Grinning Face With Sweat
description: Has the same grin and eyes as 😄 Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes but with a single, blue bead of sweat, usually over its left eye. Intended to depict nerves or discomfort but commonly used to express a close call, as if saying Whew! and wiping sweat from the forehead.

title: 🎥 Movie Camera
description: A classic movie camera. Depicted as a black camera with two mounted reels of film, viewfinder, and lens pointed left or right.

title: 🙆 Person Gesturing OK
description: A person with arms above her or his head, making an ‘OK’ sign (circle) with the whole body. No gender is specified, but this emoji is generally shown as a woman.

title: 🇸🇮 Flag: Slovenia
description: The flag for Slovenia, which may show as the letters SI on some platforms.

title: 🤡 Clown Face
description: A classic circus or birthday clown. Features white face makeup, a red nose, exaggerated eyes and smile, and two tufts of hair (red or blue). May convey that someone is silly or foolish or that something is creepy or scary.

title: 👩‍👩‍👧 Family: Woman, Woman, Girl
description: A family with two mothers, and one daughter.

title: 🧹 Broom
description: A traditional broom, as used for sweeping—or ridden by a witch. Shown at a 45° angle, with a wooden handle and yellow bristles at the lower left.

title: 🚴‍♂️ Man Biking
description: The male version of the 🚴 Bicyclist emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: 🇸🇷 Flag: Suriname
description: The flag for Suriname, which may show as the letters SR on some platforms.

title: 🚵‍♂️ Man Mountain Biking
description: The male version of the 🚵 Mountain Bicyclist emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: ‼️ Double Exclamation Mark
description: Double Exclamation Mark was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🔆 Bright Button
description: An icon of a outlined sun, used when increasing the brightness of a screen. Appears larger than the Low Brightness Symbol.

title: 🗒️ Spiral Notepad
description: A spiral-bound, flip-style notepad or notebook of lined paper, as used for everyday note-taking. Commonly used for content concerning various types of documents and writing.

title: ⌚ Watch
description: A wristwatch, as used for telling time. Appearance varies across platforms, but widely depicted as an analog timepiece with a white face and brown or black straps.

title: 🧠 Brain
description: Brain was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

title: 🐒 Monkey
description: A cheeky looking monkey, sitting down with tail curled up.

title: 🏌️‍♀️ Woman Golfing
description: The female version of the 🏌 Golfer emoji.

title: ✴️ Eight-Pointed Star
description: A star with eight points, that is commonly shown in orange, and for some reason, with only four points.

title: 👙 Bikini
description: A two-piece bikini, worn at the beach, pool, or on vacation at a tropical destination.

title: 🥂 Clinking Glasses
description: Two flutes of champagne or sparkling wine being clinked together, as done at a celebratory or convivial toast (“Cheers!”). Samsung’s design suggests two glasses of white wine. Some platforms include stylized links to mark the clinking. See also Clinking Beer Mugs—and Bottle With Popping Cork for a refill.

title: 🇳🇮 Flag: Nicaragua
description: The flag for Nicaragua, which may show as the letters NI on some platforms.

title: 📧 E-Mail
description: A symbol for email. Depicted as the back of an envelope imprinted with a capital letter E (for electronic) or @ (at) sign. Commonly used as an icon before an email address.

title: 💥 Collision
description: A symbol that represents a crash or collision. An angular burst of orange and red in a star-like shape.

title: 👨‍👨‍👧 Family: Man, Man, Girl
description: A family with two fathers, and one daughter.

title: 👓 Glasses
description: Prescription glasses, shown with a variety of frames, depending on platform.

title: 📤 Outbox Tray
description: A paper tray with an up arrow on top, as a symbol for an email outbox. Generally depicted as a white or wooden tray with a red arrow.

title: 😑 Expressionless Face
description: A yellow face with flat, closed eyes and mouth. May convey a sense of frustration or annoyance more intense than suggested by 😐 Neutral Face, as if taking a moment to collect itself.

title: 🌑 New Moon
description: New Moon was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “New Moon Symbol” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🏘️ Houses
description: Multiple houses.

title: 🥦 Broccoli
description: A rich green, tree-like head or floret of broccoli.

title: 👨‍⚕️ Man Health Worker
description: A man working in the field of health care. This may be used to represent a doctor, nurse, or pharmacist.

title: 🇮🇴 Flag: British Indian Ocean Territory
description: The flag for British Indian Ocean Territory, which may show as the letters IO on some platforms. The same flag is used for Diego Garcia.

title: 🇹🇰 Flag: Tokelau
description: The flag for Tokelau, which may show as the letters TK on some platforms.

title: 🥄 Spoon
description: A silver spoon, as used to eat soup, cereal, or ice cream as well as serve food or stir drinks. Positioned at various angles across platforms. May be paired with Fork and Knife, Fork and Knife With Plate, and Bowl With Spoon.

title: 🧼 Soap
description: A bar of soap, as used in the shower or bath. (Or to wash out the mouth of 🤬 Face With Symbols on Mouth.) Generally shown with lathered bubbles. Depicted in various colors, often pink, and at different angles.

title: 🇵🇱 Flag: Poland
description: The flag for Poland, which may show as the letters PL on some platforms.

title: 🥫 Canned Food
description: A can or tin of food, depicted as tomatoes or a generic green vegetable. May be also used to represent sauce or soup.

title: ♍ Virgo
description: The Virgo astrological sign in the Zodiac. This Zodiac Symbol represents a Maiden.

title: 👨‍👧‍👦 Family: Man, Girl, Boy
description: The Family: Man, Girl, Boy emoji is a sequence of the 👨 Man, 👧 Girl and 👦 Boy emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: ↘️ Down-Right Arrow
description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-right, or south-east direction.

title: 😻 Smiling Cat Face With Heart-Eyes
description: A cartoon cat variant of 😍 Smiling Face With Heart-Eyes. Depicted as yellow on major platforms.

title: 🐸 Frog Face
description: A frog emoji, showing the green face of a frog, with large eyes and mouth.

title: 🔣 Input Symbols
description: A symbol showing the following glyphs: 〒 (Japanese postal mark), 𝅘𝅥𝅮 (music note), & (ampersand, or sometimes an @ symbol) and % (percentage sign).

title: 🗯️ Right Anger Bubble
description: A form of speech balloon used with angular edges, used to denote angry speech in comics.

title: 🌱 Seedling
description: A seedling, a sign of spring. A new plant of some kind sprouting from the earth, hoping to grow into a large tree, flower or plant if conditions are suitable.

title: 🧦 Socks
description: Socks was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

title: 🏚️ Derelict House
description: A house which is unoccupied, and has become derelict. In a state of disrepair.

title: 🐇 Rabbit
description: A white rabbit, sometimes associated with Spring and Easter.

title: ♎ Libra
description: The Libra astrological sign in the Zodiac. This Zodiac Symbol represents weighing scales.

title: 🕸️ Spider Web
description: A spider web, shown in the symmetrical orb web shape commonly seen in cartoon form.

title: 🇭🇺 Flag: Hungary
description: The flag for Hungary, which may show as the letters HU on some platforms.

title: 🍞 Bread
description: A loaf of white or wheat bread, as before it is sliced for toast or sandwiches.

title: 👹 Ogre
description: A grotesque, red face with horns, wide eyes, a large nose, crooked fangs, and a fringe of shaggy hair. Depicts an oni, a kind of hideous ogre in Japanese folklore.

title: 🥈 2nd Place Medal
description: 2nd Place Medal was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 under the name “Second Place Medal” and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

title: 🤢 Nauseated Face
description: A sickly-green face with concerned eyes and puffed, often red cheeks, as if holding back vomit. May represent physical illness or general disgust. Not to be confused with 🤮 Face Vomiting.

title: 🌜 Last Quarter Moon Face
description: A crescent moon shape, showing a face looking right.

title: 🈺 Japanese “Open for Business” Button
description: Means “work” in Japanese.  This Emoji used to mean “open for business” and precedes business hours.

title: 🤧 Sneezing Face
description: A yellow face with scrunched, X-shaped eyes sneezing or blowing its nose into a white tissue, as if from a cold or allergies. Often depicted with a crumpled-looking mouth.

title: 🇨🇵 Flag: Clipperton Island
description: The flag for Clipperton Island, which may show as the letters CP on some platforms. Uses the same flag as France.

title: 🌤️ Sun Behind Small Cloud
description: The sun, with a small cloud in the foreground. The majority of the sun is visible.

title: 🕝 Two-Thirty
description: Two-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Two-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🍪 Cookie
description: A golden-brown chocolate chip cookie, or biscuit, though representing the baked treat more generally. Samsung, which features a pair of cookies, previously displayed this as two saltine crackers.

title: 😢 Crying Face
description: A yellow face with raised eyebrows and a slight frown, shedding a single, blue tear from one eye down its cheek. May convey a moderate degree of sadness or pain, usually less intensely than 😭 Loudly Crying Face.

title: 🇵🇼 Flag: Palau
description: The flag for Palau, which may show as the letters PW on some platforms.

title: ⚗️ Alembic
description: An apparatus for distilling, as used in medieval alchemy. Generally depicted as a round flask with a neck angled down to the right. Positioned on a short stand and containing a mysterious green, purple, or blue liquid.

title: 🧭 Compass
description: A magnetic compass, as used for navigation. Generally depicted in a silver or gold case with a compass rose and a red-tipped needle. Commonly used for various content concerning traveling and exploring as well as metaphorical compasses (e.g., moral compass).

title: 🐠 Tropical Fish
description: A fish that lives in tropical (warm) water, generally colorful in appearance.

title: 📂 Open File Folder
description: A slightly open tabbed folder, as used to file papers in a cabinet or as an icon for an opened folder when using a computer. Most platforms depict a yellow folder, as manila, with the tab shown at the left.

title: 👩‍🏭 Woman Factory Worker
description: The Woman Factory Worker emoji is a sequence of the 👩 Woman and 🏭 Factory emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🇱🇦 Flag: Laos
description: The flag for Laos, which may show as the letters LA on some platforms.

title: 🕣 Eight-Thirty
description: Eight-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eight-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🚭 No Smoking
description: No Smoking was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “No Smoking Symbol” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🛁 Bathtub
description: A white bathtub with a silver shower head. Often depicted as a cast-iron tub with claw-foot legs. Commonly used for various content concerning bathing, washing, cleaning, and bathrooms more generally.

title: 🦇 Bat
description: A black bat that enjoys the dark, shown spreading its wings.

title: ⏲️ Timer Clock
description: Time’s up! A timer set to count down and sound an alarm after a designated amount of time, as used in the kitchen. Appearance varies by platform. Commonly used for various content concerning time, including countdowns and deadlines.

title: 🧨 Firecracker
description: A firecracker, as lit on Chinese New Year, New Year's Eve, or Independence Day. Depicted as a red tube with a burning fuse, sometimes lined with gold rings at its top and base.

title: 😷 Face With Medical Mask
description: A yellow face with closed eyes wearing a white surgical mask, as used by health workers in hospitals. Also worn in East Asian cultures to avoid sickness or spreading airborne diseases.

title: 🐓 Rooster
description: A rooster; a male chicken known also as a cockerel or cock.

title: 🕥 Ten-Thirty
description: Ten-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Ten-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 📪 Closed Mailbox With Lowered Flag
description: A curbside mailbox (letterbox, postbox) with its door latched shut and signal flag lowered. Generally depicted in blue or gray with a red flag. Used for various content concerning postal deliveries and email.

title: ⏩ Fast-Forward Button
description: Two triangles pointing to the right. Most commonly used as a symbol for fast forwarding media such as video tapes, CDs, or digital audio and video.

title: 💨 Dashing Away
description: A gust of air, representing the fast movement of a person or object to the left of this character. Can be used in combination with another emoji to express motion, such as a fast runner 🏃💨 or fast car  🚗💨.

title: 🏎️ Racing Car
description: A racing car which appears as a formula one vehicle or rally car on most platforms. Generally displayed in red.

title: 🐨 Koala
description: A koala emoji, a native Australian marsupial that lives in the trees. Known for sleeping and eating the leaves of the eucalyptus tree.

title: 👊 Oncoming Fist
description: A fist displayed in a position to punch someone, or to fist-bump another person.

title: 🐩 Poodle
description: A poodle is a breed of dog, commonly seen groomed with longer hair around the head, paws and tail than the rest of the body.

title: 🍧 Shaved Ice
description: A mound of shaved ice (snow cone) served in a dessert bowl with a short spoon, flavored with a cherry-red syrup on many platforms. Associated with Hawaiian shave ice or Japanese kakigori.

title: 💘 Heart With Arrow
description: A heart emoji with an arrow through the center, like the arrow that cupid shoots for love.

title: 🧬 DNA
description: The double helix of DNA, the genetic blueprint for life. Color and orientation vary across platforms, but positioned at a 45° angle and in multiple, bright colors to represent the molecule’s spiraling, ladder-like structure.

title: 🇷🇪 Flag: Réunion
description: The flag for Réunion, which may show as the letters RE on some platforms.

title: 👩‍🦱 Woman: Curly Hair
description: The Woman: Curly Hair emoji is a sequence of the 👩 Woman and 🦱 Emoji Component Curly Hair emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🧚 Fairy
description: Fairy was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

title: 💼 Briefcase
description: A place to store notes and other office materials. Primarily used by older people.

title: ⛅ Sun Behind Cloud
description: A sun appearing from behind a cloud. Used in weather forecasts to indicate a partially sunny day.

title: 😴 Sleeping Face
description: A yellow face with eyes closed and mouth letting out three, cartoon-styled Zzz’s overhead to indicate it's sound asleep. The Zzz’s appear blue or purple across most platforms. May also represent boredom (slang, snooze).

title: 👩‍💼 Woman Office Worker
description: A woman wearing business attire. This may include items such as a shirt, blouse, tie, jacket, or headset.

title: 🚀 Rocket
description: A rocket being propelled into space.

title: 🇪🇸 Flag: Spain
description: The flag for Spain, which may show as the letters ES on some platforms.

title: ↔️ Left-Right Arrow
description: A horizontal line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing left and right.

title: ✒️ Black Nib
description: The silver nib of a fountain pen, which distributes ink onto a writing surface. Positioned at a 45° angle, with its tip at the lower left or right. Like 🖋️ Fountain Pen, commonly used for various content concerning writing, drawing, and signing (e.g., laws, deals, in sports).

title: 🇨🇭 Flag: Switzerland
description: The flag for Switzerland, which may show as the letters CH on some platforms.

title: ⚓ Anchor
description: A metal device, dropped out of a boat to prevent it drifting away from the current location.

title: 🍌 Banana
description: A ripe banana, peeled and ready to eat on major platforms. Great snack for a child or monkey.

title: 🌐 Globe With Meridians
description: A symbol of planet earth showing lines of longitude and latitude. Commonly used as an icon for internationalization, and features on the iOS software keyboard to change keyboard languages.

title: 📶 Antenna Bars
description: Bars increasing in height, showing the strength of the mobile (cellular) phone signal. More bars signifies better reception.

title: 🇵🇸 Flag: Palestinian Territories
description: The Flag: Palestinian Territories emoji is a sequence of the 🇵 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter P and 🇸 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter S emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🏣 Japanese Post Office
description: A Japanese post office, featuring the テ Japanese postal mark on the front of the building (or showing this mark instead of the building in Microsoft’s artwork).

title: 🚠 Mountain Cableway
description: Mountain Cableway was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 😓 Downcast Face With Sweat
description: A yellow face with closed eyes, frown, and a bead of sweat dripping from its forehead. Usually depicted with a single sweat bead on its right side, though Microsoft includes two.

title: 🌺 Hibiscus
description: A hibiscus emoji, a pretty flower that can be used to attract butterflies and bees.

title: 🚒 Fire Engine
description: A red fire truck, an essential part of emergency services along with a police car or ambulance.

title: 🇲🇴 Flag: Macau Sar China
description: The flag for Macau, which may show as the letters MO on some platforms.

title: 🇰🇷 Flag: South Korea
description: The flag for South Korea, which may show as the letters KR on some platforms.

title: 🐙 Octopus
description: An octopus emoji which displays two eyes and between four and eight tentacles on most platforms.

title: 🕖 Seven O’Clock
description: Seven O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Seven O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 💍 Ring
description: A ring with displaying a gem stone of some kind on the top, most likely a diamond. This piece of jewellery is often associated with a proposal and subsequent engagement to be married.

title: 🦢 Swan
description: Swan was approved as part of Unicode 11.0 in 2018 and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

title: 🏉 Rugby Football
description: The oval-shaped ball used in the game of rugby. Varies slightly in shape in the two main versions of the game: rugby union and rugby league.

title: 🚕 Taxi
description: A yellow taxicab, iconically seen in New York City. Shown from the side, as opposed to the oncoming taxi emoji.

title: 📔 Notebook With Decorative Cover
description: A closed, hardcover notebook, as used for journaling or sketching. Appearance varies across platforms, with most designs featuring relatively plain covers. Commonly used for content concerning writing and schooling.

title: 🚳 No Bicycles
description: A bicycle with a red stroke through it, indicating that bikes are prohibited from this location.

title: 🇵🇳 Flag: Pitcairn Islands
description: The Flag: Pitcairn Islands emoji is a sequence of the 🇵 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter P and 🇳 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter N emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🕹️ Joystick
description: A joystick, as used in playing classic arcade, computer, or video games. Generally depicted with a black base, red-knobbed control stick, and one or more red buttons.

title: ™️ Trade Mark
description: A trademark symbol, the letters TM displayed after a word that is trademarked.

title: 💬 Speech Balloon
description: A cartoon-style balloon used to represent spoken word in comics. Sometimes  used in communication apps to indicate that another person is typing a message.

title: 👨‍🏭 Man Factory Worker
description: The Man Factory Worker emoji is a sequence of the 👨 Man and 🏭 Factory emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 👷 Construction Worker
description: A construction worker wearing a hard-hat (safety helmet). Has a high visibility vest or hammer in some variations.

title: ☪️ Star and Crescent
description: The crescent moon and star is a symbol often associated with the religion of Islam. This symbol can be found on the flags of many countries, such as Algeria, Azerbaijan, Malaysia, Pakistan and Turkey.

title: 🇳🇺 Flag: Niue
description: The flag for Niue, which may show as the letters NU on some platforms.

title: 🎾 Tennis
description: A tennis racket (racquet) with a tennis ball. Only a ball is shown on Apple, LG, Twitter, Facebook, and Mozilla platforms.

title: 🚚 Delivery Truck
description: Delivery Truck was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🆗 OK Button
description: The letters OK, shown enclosed in a square. Meaning Okay, denoting approval. The opposite of the Squared NG Emoji.

title: 🚢 Ship
description: A large ship, used for transport of people or cargo across the ocean. May be a cruise ship, commonly found around tropical locations.

title: 🇹🇭 Flag: Thailand
description: The flag for Thailand, which may show as the letters TH on some platforms.

title: 🎶 Musical Notes
description: Three eighth notes (quavers in British English), used to represent music or singing. Sometimes inserted next to quoted lyrics, to make it clear that they are part of a song.

title: 🚸 Children Crossing
description: A crossing sign for children, usually positioned near schools or other areas that drivers should be cautious of young children in the area.

title: 📓 Notebook
description: A dark-colored, hardcover notebook, as used to write or take notes in school. Commonly used for various content concerning writing and schooling.

title: 🔋 Battery
description: An electric battery, as used to power such devices as a flashlight. Generally depicted as an upright, green cylinder, as a AA or D cell, with white indicators for its positive (facing up) and negative terminals.

title: 📃 Page With Curl
description: A white piece of paper, curled up at the bottom to the left or right, with text printed on it, as a business letter. Commonly used for content concerning various types of documents and writing.

title: 🎇 Sparkler
description: A  sparkler: a form of hand-held firework often used at parties and celebrations. The sparkler is lit at one end, and held at the other.

title: 🐝 Honeybee
description: A bee emoji, buzzing in the air. Shown with yellow and black stripes, and light colored wings.

title: 🚦 Vertical Traffic Light
description: A set of red, orange (amber) and green traffic lights, used at intersections. More common than the horizontal traffic light.

title: 👩‍🦲 Woman: Bald
description: The Woman: Bald emoji is a sequence of the 👩 Woman and 🦲 Emoji Component Bald emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🚲 Bicycle
description: A bicycle, sometimes called a push bike, used for transport or sport.

title: 👡 Woman’s Sandal
description: A sandal worn by a woman in summer, spring, or other weather that suits open-toed footwear. Has a heel at the back providing additional height to the wearer.

title: 🔓 Unlocked
description: An unlocked padlock, as used to secure a latch or chain, or as an icon for a non-secure connection or open access online. Generally depicted with a gold base and silver shackle, as an open 🔒 Locked.

title: ⏹️ Stop Button
description: A stop icon, displayed as a square.

title: 👶 Baby
description: The face of a young infant (baby). Shows the face of a baby with a small amount of hair on most platforms, while some variations show a pacifier (dummy) in its mouth. Android previously displayed this emoji as a swaddled baby.

title: 🇩🇬 Flag: Diego Garcia
description: The flag for Diego Garcia, which may show as the letters DG on some platforms. The same flag is used for British Indian Ocean Territory.

title: 🧪 Test Tube
description: A test tube, as used to conduct chemical experiments in a laboratory. Depicted as a clear cylinder, open at one end and containing a green liquid. Positioned at a 45° angle.

title: 🇦🇽 Flag: Åland Islands
description: The flag for Åland Islands, which may show as the letters AX on some platforms.

title: 🇷🇴 Flag: Romania
description: The flag for Romania, which may show as the letters RO on some platforms.

title: 🎩 Top Hat
description: A top hat, worn in traditional British weddings and other formal occasions. This is also a popular playing piece in the game of Monopoly.

title: 🇨🇻 Flag: Cape Verde
description: The flag for Cape Verde, which may show as the letters CV on some platforms.

title: 🔵 Blue Circle
description: Blue Circle was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Large Blue Circle” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: ❗ Exclamation Mark
description: Exclamation Mark was approved as part of Unicode 5.2 in 2009 under the name “Heavy Exclamation Mark Symbol” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🔇 Muted Speaker
description: A speaker with a red line through it, indicating muted volume or silencing of audio.

title: 🧑 Person
description: An adult with no gender specified. This may be used as a gender-inclusive alternative to the man or woman emoji.

title: ♦️ Diamond Suit
description: A diamond symbol emoji, which is used in card games for the diamonds suit.

title: 💛 Yellow Heart
description: A yellow or gold colored love-heart. Inexplicably, this displayed as a pink hairy heart on Android 4.4.

title: 🇨🇾 Flag: Cyprus
description: The flag for Cyprus, which may show as the letters CY on some platforms.

title: 🇧🇷 Flag: Brazil
description: The flag for Brazil, which may show as the letters BR on some platforms.

title: ⛰️ Mountain
description: A mountain shown with two peaks and blue sky. Similar to the snow capped mountain emoji.

title: 🍛 Curry Rice
description: A plate of orange-brown curry with vegetables or meat, served with a mound of white rice. May represent kare-raisu, or Japanese curry, though commonly associated with India and other Asian cuisines.

title: 👨‍👩‍👦 Family: Man, Woman, Boy
description: The Family: Man, Woman, Boy emoji is a sequence of the 👨 Man, 👩 Woman and 👦 Boy emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🥘 Shallow Pan of Food
description: A flat, shallow, black pan with side handles, containing saffron-colored rice, vegetables, a leg of poultry, and/or shrimp and lemon slices. Commonly associated with paella, a traditional dish from Spain. May be used for eating, cooking, dining, and meals more generally.

title: ⛓️ Chains
description: Two parallel lengths of silver chain. Occasionally used as an icon before a hyperlink or for metaphorical connections or chains, e.g., slang off the chains.

title: 🅿️ P Button
description: P Button was approved as part of Unicode 5.2 in 2009 under the name “Negative Squared Latin Capital Letter P” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🌁 Foggy
description: Foggy weather displayed as fog covering a bridge or cityscape, depending on the platform. For platforms that show a bridge, the red Golden Gate Bridge is generally displayed.

title: 🇵🇷 Flag: Puerto Rico
description: The flag for Puerto Rico, which may show as the letters PR on some platforms.

title: 🎛️ Control Knobs
description: Four control knobs, as adjust audio levels on a mixing console. Generally depicted as a silver square with black knobs, turned to various levels as indicated by white pointers and scale markings.

title: 👵 Old Woman
description: An elderly woman with gray (grey) hair, and visible wrinkles. Wears glasses on some platforms.

title: 🇬🇾 Flag: Guyana
description: The flag for Guyana, which may show as the letters GY on some platforms.

title: 🏜️ Desert
description: Desert was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🅱️ B Button (Blood Type)
description: A symbol representing Blood Type B. Displayed as the letter B on a red background.

title: 🈚 Japanese “Free of Charge” Button
description: This means to lack, or have none of something.

title: 🈵 Japanese “No Vacancy” Button
description: This emoji means “full” in Japanese, usually used to denote “full capacity” such as a gas/petrol tank on a car or pre-paid phone card.

title: 🎴 Flower Playing Cards
description: A type of cards known as hanafuda cards in Japan which are used for a range of different games that require associating pictures (there are no numbers on the cards).

title: 🥙 Stuffed Flatbread
description: A flatbread, like pita, stuffed with lettuce, tomato, and/or meat. Resembles a doner kebab, falafel, shawarma, or gyro sandwich, popular in the Middle East and the Mediterranean. Apple and WhatsApp add red onion and cucumber. Not to be confused with the Burrito.

title: 🇴🇲 Flag: Oman
description: The flag for Oman, which may show as the letters OM on some platforms.

title: 🕠 Five-Thirty
description: Five-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Five-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 😵 Dizzy Face
description: A yellow face with X’s or spirals for eyes and a round, open mouth. Often depicted with raised or furrowed eyebrows. Facebook’s design features a purple forehead.

title: 🖍️ Crayon
description: A crayon, as children use to color. Depicted as red on most platforms with two black stripes on its label, resembling a Crayola crayon. Positioned at a 45° angle, its tip at the lower left. Commonly used for various content concerning drawing, colors, arts and crafts, and schooling.

title: 🇱🇨 Flag: St. Lucia
description: The Flag: St. Lucia emoji is a sequence of the 🇱 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter L and 🇨 Regional Indicator Symbol Letter C emojis. These display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🧗 Person Climbing
description: A rock climber, shown climbing up a rock formation. Some platforms show the climber with a helmet and/or rope. The Emojipedia Sample image was created with assistance from World Champion Rock Climber Sasha DiGiulian.

title: 🇩🇰 Flag: Denmark
description: The flag for Denmark, which may show as the letters DK on some platforms.

title: ☸️ Wheel of Dharma
description: A symbol often used in relation to the Indian religions of Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism and Jainism.

title: 🌒 Waxing Crescent Moon
description: The moon shown with only a small portion of the right side lit, and the rest in shadow.

title: 🕺 Man Dancing
description: A man dancing, added as a gender pair for the 💃 Woman Dancing. Shown on most platforms in a 70s-era suit, and one hand in the air in a disco-dancing style.

title: 📢 Loudspeaker
description: A loudspeaker used to make announcements in public areas such as schools, or sporting grounds.

title: 🖱️ Computer Mouse
description: A mouse, as used to control a cursor on a computer. Generally depicted as a white or gray, cordless device with a scroll wheel between left- and right-click buttons.

title: 🇻🇺 Flag: Vanuatu
description: The flag for Vanuatu, which may show as the letters VU on some platforms.

title: 🕚 Eleven O’Clock
description: Eleven O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eleven O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 👱‍♂️ Man: Blond Hair
description: The male version of the 👱 Person With Blond Hair emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji

title: 🔦 Flashlight
description: An everyday flashlight (electric torch), as used when the power goes out, camping, or telling scary stories. Generally depicted at a 45° angle as a gray and black device with a switch, shown illuminated on many platforms.

title: 🔳 White Square Button
description: White Square Button.

title: 🇧🇹 Flag: Bhutan
description: The flag for Bhutan, which may show as the letters BT on some platforms.

title: 🔟 Keycap: 10
description: The number 10 on a square with rounded corners, designed to look like a keycap.

title: 🤨 Face With Raised Eyebrow
description: A yellow face with a flat, neutral mouth and furrowed eyebrows, its left raised higher than its right. Conveys a wide variety of sentiments, including suspicion, skepticism, concern, consideration, disbelief, and disapproval.

title: 🌔 Waxing Gibbous Moon
description: The moon shown mostly lit, with a small portion of the left side in shadow.

title: ➖ Heavy Minus Sign
description: Heavy Minus Sign was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🔏 Locked With Pen
description: A locked (closed) padlock with a fountain pen or nib positioned at various angles in front of it. Vendors implement the same design as their 🔒 Locked and the same or similar design as their 🖋️ Fountain Pen or ✒️ Black Nib.

title: 👁️‍🗨️ Eye in Speech Bubble
description: A speech bubble showing an eye inside. When using text-to-speech on Apple platforms, this emoji is read aloud as: "Eye in speech bubble representing anti-bullying campaign". This emoji was released in conjunction with the Ad Council for the I Am A Witness campaign.

title: 🧘‍♂️ Man in Lotus Position
description: The Man in Lotus Position emoji is a sequence of the 🧘 Person in Lotus Position and ♂ Male Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🇳🇴 Flag: Norway
description: The flag for Norway, which may show as the letters NO on some platforms.

title: 🦔 Hedgehog
description: A hedgehog, generally shown from the side or front. Appears to be smiling on a number of platforms. Though unrelated, some may use this as an Echidna.

title: 🇷🇺 Flag: Russia
description: The flag for Russia, which may show as the letters RU on some platforms.

title: 🦖 T-Rex
description: A Tyrannosaurus rex; a large carnivore with a heavy tail, and short arms. This is one of two dinosaur emojis.

title: 🇲🇿 Flag: Mozambique
description: The flag for Mozambique, which may show as the letters MZ on some platforms.

title: 🛩️ Small Airplane
description: A light aircraft which is shown with propellers on some platforms.

title: 🇸🇩 Flag: Sudan
description: The flag for Sudan, which may show as the letters SD on some platforms.

title: 🍰 Shortcake
description: A slice of strawberry shortcake, layered with whipped cream and topped with a whole strawberry. Like the Birthday Cake, may be used to represent birthday celebrations or cake in general.

title: 🦸 Superhero
description: A hero which may be displayed as a man,woman or gender-neutral / gender-inclusive depending on the platform. This base emoji does not specify a gender, but is used to create the emojis for Man Superhero and Woman Superhero.

title: 😇 Smiling Face With Halo
description: A yellow face with smiling eyes, closed smile, and halo, usually blue, overhead. Often represents angels, prayers, and blessings. May also convey angelic behavior, e.g., doing good deeds. See also 👼 Baby Angel.

title: 🧯 Fire Extinguisher
description: A fire extinguisher, as used to put out small fires. Depicted as a red tank with a black hose and pressure gauge. Most platforms include an image of a flame on a white label.

title: 🛎️ Bellhop Bell
description: Ding! A call bell, as pressed at a front desk or reception to alert staff for service, such as from a concierge or bellhop (porter) to carry luggage at a hotel. Generally depicted as a golden bell on a wooden stand.

title: 😲 Astonished Face
description: A yellow face with open eyes, raised eyebrows, and an open mouth, as if gasping in shock or surprise. Often depicted showing its upper teeth. May convey a wide range of emotions, including awe, amazement, admiration, disbelief, excitement, or concern.

title: 🔛 On! Arrow
description: On! Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “On With Exclamation Mark With Left Right Arrow Above” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🧖‍♀️ Woman in Steamy Room
description: The Woman in Steamy Room emoji is a sequence of the 🧖 Person in Steamy Room and ♀ Female Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🇫🇲 Flag: Micronesia
description: The flag for Micronesia, which may show as the letters FM on some platforms.

title: 🤙 Call Me Hand
description: A hand with thumb and little (pinky) finger extended, making a traditional phone-like shape. May be used in conjunction with a face to suggest “call me” (please).

title: ▶️ Play Button
description: A triangle-shaped arrow, pointing right. Commonly used as a symbol for play.

title: 🗽 Statue of Liberty
description: The Statue of Liberty, often used as a depiction of New York City.

title: 👛 Purse
description: A place to keep coins and perhaps notes of money, for females. The male equivalent would be a wallet.

title: 🏊‍♀️ Woman Swimming
description: The female version of the 🏊 Swimmer emoji.

title: 💑 Couple With Heart
description: A couple standing next to each other, smiling, with a pink love heart floating in the air between them. Generally displayed as a woman and man.

title: 🇸🇪 Flag: Sweden
description: The flag for Sweden, which may show as the letters SE on some platforms.

title: ☮️ Peace Symbol
description: A circular symbol, commonly used as a representation of peace. Alternatives include the Victory Hand, or the Dove of Peace.

title: 👋 Waving Hand
description: A hand waving most commonly used to say “hello” or “goodbye”.

title: 🐳 Spouting Whale
description: A whale emoji, spouting water out of its blowhole. Shows with a more cartoon-like appearance on iOS, compared to the regular whale emoji.

title: 🇸🇲 Flag: San Marino
description: The flag for San Marino, which may show as the letters SM on some platforms.

title: 👐 Open Hands
description: Two open hands, representing openness. Sometimes used as a hug, or as a display of jazz hands.

title: 🗻 Mount Fuji
description: Mount Fuji (called Fuji-san in Japan) is the largest mountain in Japan. Often seen with snow on the peak in colder months of the year.

title: 💢 Anger Symbol
description: A red symbol found in Anime/Manga and used to represent the veins popping on a very angry person.

title: 🕞 Three-Thirty
description: Three-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Three-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🚴‍♀️ Woman Biking
description: The female version of the 🚴 Bicyclist emoji.

title: 📴 Mobile Phone Off
description: A sign indicating that mobile phones should be turned off. Used in situations such as a cinema or live performance.

title: 😟 Worried Face
description: A yellow face with open eyes, raised or furrowed eyebrows, and a broad frown. May convey a variety of moderately sad or tense emotions, including concern, anxiety, alarm, disappointment, and unhappiness.

title: ▪️ Black Small Square
description: Black Small Square was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 💷 Pound Banknote
description: Quids in! A banded stack of pound banknotes, the paper currency of the United Kingdom (England, Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland). Color and detail vary across platforms, but widely depicted as purple £20 notes with the pound sign, £.

title: 🚼 Baby Symbol
description: The symbol for a baby, usually used to indicate a room that is suitable to change a baby in. Often located in or near public restrooms.

title: 📉 Chart Decreasing
description: A graph showing a colored trend line, often blue, decreasing over time, as stock prices or revenues. Commonly used to represent various types of decrease, from numeral data to being metaphorically down. May also represent facts, figures, and charts more generally.

title: 🥶 Cold Face
description: An icy-blue face with gritted teeth usually depicted with icicles clinging to its cheeks or jaw, as if frozen from extreme cold. May also represent unfriendliness (slang, cold) or excellence (slang, cool or chill).

title: 🇮🇲 Flag: Isle of Man
description: The flag for Isle of Man, which may show as the letters IM on some platforms.

title: ♨️ Hot Springs
description: Representation of hot springs with steam rising from a circular tub. This is the common symbol used to represent an onsen on maps in Japan.

title: 🍥 Fish Cake With Swirl
description: A slice of Japanese narutomaki, a ridged fishcake of processed whitefish with an iconic pink swirl, often served in ramen or oden. Thanks to its distinct swirl, may be used for flair.

title: 🐎 Horse
description: A galloping horse with saddle. The same as the Horse Racing Emoji, but without a jockey riding it. Created in a photorealistic style in Apple’s artwork, and cartoon style in Google’s version.

title: 😝 Squinting Face With Tongue
description: A yellow face with scrunched, X-shaped eyes and a big grin, sticking out its tongue. Often conveys a sense of fun, excitement, playfulness, hilarity, and happiness, as if saying Squee! or Awesome!

title: 🌗 Last Quarter Moon
description: Last Quarter Moon was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Last Quarter Moon Symbol” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🧗‍♀️ Woman Climbing
description: A female rock climber, shown climbing up a rock formation. Some platforms show the climber with a helmet, and/or rope.

title: 📯 Postal Horn
description: A postal horn (post horn). Depicted as a coiled, valveless, brass horn, like a bugle or trumpet, with two red tassels. Sometimes used to mark announcements as well as for various content concerning brass instruments, music, or mail.

title: ☯️ Yin Yang
description: Yin Yang was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🏬 Department Store
description: A large department store, selling a range of products to the general public. Shown as a large building with a billboard on most platforms, or as a shopping bag on Windows.

title: 🔉 Speaker Medium Volume
description: A speaker cone displayed with one sound wave, generally used as an icon to indicate the decreasing of volume on a phone or computer.

title: 🥢 Chopsticks
description: A pair of equal-length chopsticks, an eating utensil used throughout East Asia. Design and color vary widely by platform, though often red or wood-colored and with tips angled together. Featured in many platforms' Steaming Bowl of Food and Takeout Box. A counterpart to utensils such as Fork and Knife and Spoon.

title: 🧵 Thread
description: A spool of thread, as used for sewing. Thread color varies across platforms, though often depicted in red or blue and on a wooden spool. Sometimes shown with an end unraveling.

title: 🇳🇨 Flag: New Caledonia
description: The flag for New Caledonia, which may show as the letters NC on some platforms.

title: 🙃 Upside-Down Face
description: A classic smiley, turned upside down. Implemented as a flipped version of 🙂 Slightly Smiling Face on most platforms.

title: 💆‍♀️ Woman Getting Massage
description: The Woman Getting Massage emoji is a sequence of the 💆 Face Massage and ♀ Female Sign emojis. These are combined using a zero width joiner between each character and display as a single emoji on supported platforms.

title: 🔷 Large Blue Diamond
description: Large Blue Diamond was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 👨‍💼 Man Office Worker
description: A man wearing business attire. This may include items such as a shirt, tie, jacket, or headset.

title: 🇧🇳 Flag: Brunei
description: The flag for Brunei Darussalam, which may show as the letters BN on some platforms.

title: ❕ White Exclamation Mark
description: White Exclamation Mark was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “White Exclamation Mark Ornament” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

title: 🕌 Mosque
description: A mosque building, a place of worship for followes of Islam. Shown with a domed roof and a minaret.

title: 🏫 School
description: A school building with multiple storeys, and a clock on the front. A place that children, or teenagers attend for their education.

title: 🍴 Fork and Knife
description: A silver fork to the left of a knife, silverware or cutlery used to eat a meal. Often used more generally for eating and dining. May be paired with Spoon or used with Fork and Knife With Plate.

title: 🥊 Boxing Glove
description: A padded boxing glove, used in the sport of boxing. Usually red.

title: 🇪🇺 Flag: European Union
description: The flag for European Union, which may show as the letters EU on some platforms.

title: 🇧🇶 Flag: Caribbean Netherlands
description: The Caribbean Netherlands, a group of islands in the Caribbean Sea. The design for this emoji is shown as the flag for Bonaire on most platforms.

title: 👀 Eyes
description: A pair of eyes, glancing slightly to the left on most platforms. The Google version of this emoji previously showed only a single eye, despite the name of this character being eyes (plural).

title: 🖇️ Linked Paperclips
description: Two or more silver paper clips linked together, generally forming an inverted V. Microsoft’s design displays three paper clips.
